item.title: 布鲁克蒙特准备 "补贴 "陷入困境的巨灾债券 ETF
item.description: 布鲁克蒙特资本管理公司（Brookmont Capital Management）准备用自己的资金来支持世界上第一只以巨灾债券为基础的交易所交易基金，因为投资者对他们将在价值 12.6 万亿美元的 ETF 市场上接受的资产种类划定了界限。【原文：Brookmont Capital Management is ready to use its own money to prop up the world’s first exchange-traded fund built on catastrophe bonds, as investors draw the line on the kinds of assets they’ll embrace in the $12.6 trillion ETF market.】

item.title: 荷兰养老金延迟给 "拥挤 "的债券市场交易带来风险
item.description: 据法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）称，荷兰养老基金推迟向一套新规则过渡，给债券市场最受欢迎的交易之一带来了风险。【原文：Dutch pension funds delaying their transition to a new set of rules pose a risk to one of the bond market’s favorite trades, according to Societe Generale SA.】

item.title: 花旗集团称去美元化说法是 "幻觉
item.description: 花旗集团的分析师们驳斥了全球投资者正在寻求减少对美元依赖的观点，认为去美元化的说法是一种 "海市蜃楼"，没有经济数据的支持。【原文：Citigroup Inc. analysts have dismissed the idea that global investors are seeking to reduce their reliance on the dollar, describing the de-dollarization narrative as a “mirage” that’s not supported by economic data.】

item.title: 诺巴银行支持者寻求从斯德哥尔摩首次公开募股中获得高达 8.1 亿美元的资金
item.description: 诺巴银行集团（NOBA Bank Group AB）的股东希望在该公司的斯德哥尔摩首次公开募股中筹集高达 76 亿瑞典克朗（约合 8.1 亿美元）的资金，为欧洲一连串大规模的新股发行添砖加瓦。【原文：NOBA Bank Group AB’s shareholders are looking to raise as much as 7.6 billion Swedish kronor ($810 million) in the firm’s Stockholm initial public offering, adding to a string of substantial new issuances in Europe.】

item.title: 水危机笼罩约翰内斯堡，市长吹捧新战略
item.description: 约翰内斯堡市长告诉南非立法者，他的政府已经提高了修复城市供水基础设施的预算，并在居民抗议供水不足的几天后加快实施一项扭转局面的计划。【原文：Johannesburg’s mayor told South African lawmakers that his administration has raised the budget for fixing the city’s water infrastructure and is accelerating a turnaround plan days after residents protested against lack of supply.】

item.title: 全球液化天然气激增促使欧洲提前退出俄罗斯供应
item.description:
该集团正在考虑将退出莫斯科油轮运输天然气的时间提前一年。【原文：

The bloc is considering accelerating its exit from Moscow’s tanker-borne gas by a year.

】

item.title: Frigoglass 正在洽谈出售尼日利亚业务，以偿还债务
item.description: 总部位于英国的饮料冷却器制造商 Frigoglass 集团正在洽谈出售其尼日利亚业务，该公司是非洲最大的玻璃容器生产商，希望在即将到期的债务之前筹集现金。【原文：Frigoglass Group, the UK-based manufacturer of beverage coolers, is in talks to sell its Nigerian business, Africa’s largest glass container producer, as it looks to raise cash ahead of looming debt maturities.】

item.title: 我曾是个古怪的孩子少年黑客的狱中自白
item.description:
诺亚-乌尔班（Noah Urban）在臭名昭著的 "散蜘蛛"（Scattered Spider）团伙中扮演的角色是劝说人们在不知情的情况下让罪犯访问敏感的计算机系统。【原文：

Noah Urban’s role in the notorious Scattered Spider gang was talking people into unwittingly giving criminals access to sensitive computer systems.

】

item.title: 日本央行减持 ETF 对日本意味着什么？
item.description: 日本央行计划开始平仓其持有的交易所交易基金，这一过程可能需要一个多世纪才能完成。根据摩根士丹利 MUFG 策略师的计算，截至 9 月中旬，日本央行持有的 ETF 市值约为 79.5 万亿日元（约合 5370 亿美元），未实现收益约为 43.8 万亿日元。【原文：The Bank of Japan plans to start unwinding its exchange-traded fund holdings, in a process that could take more than a century to complete. As of mid-September, the BOJ held about ¥79.5 trillion ($537 billion) of ETFs by market value and had around ¥43.8 trillion of unrealized gains, according to calculations by Morgan Stanley MUFG strategists.】

item.title: 穆勒称欧洲央行利率具有温和支持性，无需降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）表示，欧洲中央银行正在实施略微宽松的货币政策，目前没有理由进一步降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank is running a slightly accommodative monetary policy and currently has no reason to lower borrowing costs any further, according to Governing Council member Madis Muller.】

item.title: 据说 Glencore 正在就出售刚果重要铜矿进行谈判
item.description: Glencore Plc 一直在就出售其最大非洲铜矿的控股权进行谈判，这是迄今为止最明显的迹象，表明这家大宗商品贸易商愿意放弃对其旗舰资产之一的控制权。【原文：Glencore Plc has been holding talks about selling a controlling stake in its biggest African copper mine, in the clearest sign yet that the commodity trader is open to relinquishing control of one of its flagship assets.】

item.title: 初创企业依靠曾经罕见的股票销售留住人才
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，凯特-克拉克（Kate Clark）将探讨初创企业越来越多地使用二级股票销售作为留住优秀员工的一种方式。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kate Clark looks at the increasing use of secondary share sales by startups as a way to retain their talented employees.】

item.description: 我是美国财政部驻华盛顿记者丹尼尔-弗拉特利。今天我们关注的是特朗普政府的无名中国会谈。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Daniel Flatley, the US Treasury correspondent in Washington. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 苹果 AirPods Pro 3 耳机的升级足以成为必备之选
item.description:
评论：该公司的新款耳塞在佩戴和音质方面都远远优于之前的型号。【原文：

Review: The company’s new earbuds fit and sound far better than prior models.

】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为，鉴于招聘放缓，2025 年美联储将再削减两次薪资
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他支持美国央行本周降息的决定，并计划今年再降息两次。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said he supported the US central bank’s decision to lower interest rates this week and penciled in two additional cuts this year.】

item.title: 阿波罗希望获得西班牙马德里竞技足球俱乐部的多数股权
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is in talks to acquire a majority stake in Spanish football club Atlético de Madrid, a deal that would be a sizable investment for its new sports fund, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马来西亚法院驳回纳吉布软禁案禁言令申请
item.description: 据《新海峡时报》（New Straits Times）报道，马来西亚高等法院驳回了政府提出的旨在阻止公众讨论被监禁的前总理纳吉布-拉扎克（Najib Razak）申请软禁一事的申请。【原文：Malaysia’s High Court dismissed a government application aimed at preventing public discourse over jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak’s bid to serve house arrest, the New Straits Times reported.】

item.title: 中国两大太阳能巨头结束法律之争，行业陷入困境
item.description: 隆基绿色能源科技股份有限公司（LONGI Green Energy Technology Co.【原文：LONGi Green Energy Technology Co. and Jinko Solar Co. have agreed to settle their patent lawsuits to help promote growth in an industry that has struggled with overcapacity and deep losses.】

item.title: Uniper 向 ResInvest 出售 Datteln 4 燃煤发电厂
item.description: Uniper SE 同意将其在德国的 Datteln 4 燃煤发电厂出售给捷克共和国的 ResInvest Group AS。【原文：Uniper SE agreed to sell its Datteln 4 coal-fired power plant in Germany to the Czech Republic’s ResInvest Group AS.】

item.title: 债券交易商与限制回购市场杠杆率的建议展开斗争
item.description: 包括英格兰银行在内的监管机构正在提出一项旨在限制过度杠杆化的政策，债券交易商对此表示反对，并警告说这可能会产生意想不到的后果。【原文：Bond traders are pushing back against a policy intended to cap excessive leverage that is being proposed by regulators including the Bank of England, warning it may have unintended consequences.】

item.title: 安哥拉排除在致命罢工后进一步提高燃料价格的可能性
item.description: 安哥拉不太可能提高燃料价格，因为政府正在评估今年早些时候削减补贴引发致命街头抗议的影响。【原文：Angola is unlikely to raise fuel prices while the government evaluates the impact of subsidy cuts earlier in the year that sparked deadly street protests.】

item.title: 中国 iPhone 买家抱怨新 Pro 机型有划痕
item.description: 周五，中国的许多小商品购物者在社交媒体上晒出了苹果公司新发布的 iPhone 17 系列产品背面划痕的照片，这可能会给该公司的旗舰产品的发布造成影响。【原文：Many gadget shoppers in China took to social media on Friday with photos of scratches on the back of the newly released iPhone 17 lineup from Apple Inc., potentially marring the launch of the company’s marquee product.】

item.title: 美银美林哈特内特称 "华丽七号 "股票泡沫仍在扩大
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，美国大型科技股在过去两年中形成的泡沫还在继续，投资者应为更多收益做好准备。【原文：The bubble that has formed in US Big Tech stocks over the past two years has further to run and investors should position for more gains, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 津巴布韦财政部官员称 2030 年后不会有延长美元使用期的新计划
item.description: 津巴布韦重申其计划到 2030 年停止在这个南部非洲国家的国内使用美元，尽管绿卡仍然是大多数支付的首选货币。【原文：Zimbabwe reiterated its plan to halt the domestic use of dollars in the southern African nation by 2030, even as the greenback remains the preferred currency for a majority of payments.】

item.title: 据说 FountainVest 和 CPE 接近 6 亿美元收购 SML
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 FountainVest Partners 和 CPE 即将达成联合收购 SML Group Ltd. 的协议，该交易对 RFID 和品牌识别供应商的估值可能超过 6 亿美元。【原文：Private equity firms FountainVest Partners and CPE are nearing an agreement to jointly buy SML Group Ltd. in a deal that could value the RFID and brand identification provider at more than $600 million, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国例外论不再包括曾经强大的美元
item.description:
全球投资者正将资金投入对冲美元风险的基金。【原文：

Global investors are pouring money into funds that hedge against exposure to the greenback. 

】

item.title: 据称国际金融公司和亚洲开发银行将投资菲律宾今年最大的首次公开募股
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，国际金融公司和亚洲开发银行将成为菲律宾 Maynilad Water Services Inc.【原文：The International Finance Corp. and Asian Development Bank are set to become cornerstone investors in the initial public offering of the Philippines’ Maynilad Water Services Inc., according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国皇家邮政母公司 IDS 计划发行自 Kretinsky 收购以来的首批债券
item.description: 经营英国皇家邮政服务的国际配送服务有限公司计划在被捷克亿万富翁丹尼尔-克雷廷斯基收购后的首次债务销售中筹集两笔基准规模的欧元债券。【原文：International Distribution Services Ltd., which operates the UK’s Royal Mail postal service, is planning to raise two benchmark-sized euro bonds in its first debt sale since being bought by Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky.】

item.title: 盈利预期上升，股市跑赢关税风险
item.description: 美国股市正以创纪录的水平交易，财报季即将来临，对美国企业利润增长的预期不断改善，表明涨势可能会持续下去。【原文：US stocks are trading at record levels with earnings season right around the corner, and improving expectations for Corporate America’s profit growth indicate that the rally can keep going.】

item.title: 公共债务接近法定上限，泰国将削减 8%的借贷
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，随着公共债务接近法定上限，泰国计划在 10 月开始的一年内将政府借贷减少约 8%，以维持财政纪律。【原文：Thailand plans to reduce government borrowing by about 8% in the year starting October to maintain fiscal discipline as public debt approaches the legal limit, according to people familiar with the matter.】
